page.title: 06The Welsh Language In Dinas
page.content: According to census returns,In{1951 Welsh was spoken in Dinas by{83.6%}of the population.But in{1961}the amount dropped down to{77%.}Then in{1971}it dropped down again to{70.9%.}Then it dropped yet again to{59.6%.}It had gone down every ten years.Less and less each time . Why is this?.In{1951}I think more people spoke Welsh because there weren't so many people from other places.Most people were local people,and spoke Welsh all the time.In our school now,{1985,}only {29%}children speak Welsh out of 51 children.But experts predict that the amount of Welsh language spoken in Dinas in years to come gets even less if present trends continue.In{1991}- {50.7%}.Then by {2001}it will be{40.8%. Sadly the Welsh language seems to be fading away.{Bethan Rees
